title: label-has-for deprecated in 6.1
body:
In `jsx-a11y`, `label-has-for` is now deprecated as of 6.1.

https://github.com/evcohen/eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y/blob/master/docs/rules/label-has-for.md

I believe it has been replaced entirely by [label-has-associated-control](https://github.com/evcohen/eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y/blob/v6.1.0/docs/rules/label-has-associated-control.md)

title: no-unused-expressions ?
body:
In zepto.js :
```
window.$ === undefined && (window.$ = Zepto);
```
I'm using vscode + eslint + eslint-config-airbnb-base@latest, then show
```
[eslint] Expected an assignment or function call and instead saw an expression. (no-unused-expressions)

```
and I change .eslintrc: 
```
"extends": "standard",
```
the warning disappeared.

Is this a bug or improper grammar ?

title: Fixed issue by adding return in map
[Arrays] To convert an array-like object to an array, use spreads ... instead of Array.from
body:
I do not agree with what you can read in paragraph [4.4](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#arrays--from).

In fact, my understanding is that _spread syntax_ can only be applied to _iterable objects_ and not to _array-like objects_.

References:

- [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/Spread_syntax#Only_for_iterables)
- [Javscript.info](https://javascript.info/rest-parameters-spread-operator#spread-operator)

Before changes introduced with issue #1084, you could read:

> To convert an _array-like object_ to an array, use **Array.from**

which I consider being correct.


Furthermore, I would personally expand it by saying:

> To convert an _iterable object_ or an _array-like object_ to an array, use **Array.from**

That is because I agree with the authors of [Javscript.info](https://javascript.info/rest-parameters-spread-operator#spread-operator):

> So, for the task of turning something into an array, Array.from tends to be more universal.
